business.headline: Sebi says will challenge order directing case against Madhabi Buch, othersCalling the complainant "frivolous and habitual litigant", Sebi said that it would initiate appropriate legal steps to challenge the special court order to file a case against former chief Madhabi Puri Buch and others.

Adani Group revives US investment plans amid ongoing bribery case: ReportFor now, Adani Group's US footprint remains minimal. Past talks with American companies about petrochemical projects in Texas never led to major deals.

Paytm clarifies FEMA allegations on acquired subsidiaries. Details hereThe company is seeking legal advice and will take necessary steps to resolve the matter through appropriate regulatory processes in line with applicable laws.

US food delivery firm Grubhub lays off 500 employees. Here's whyGrubhub is laying off as many as 500 employees, over 20 per cent of its workforce, following its acquisition by Wonder. The layoffs, spanning all departments, aim to streamline operations as the company integrates with its new parent.

Tuhin Kanta Pandey assumes charge as 11th Sebi chairmanTuhin Kanta Pandey took charge as the 11th Sebi chairman, succeeding Madhabi Puri Buch, who completed her tenure. A former Finance Secretary, Pandey has been appointed for three years.

India to remain fastest growing major economy with 6.5% growth in FY26: IMFIndia's strong economic performance, the IMF said, provides an opportunity for the country to advance critical and challenging structural reforms to realise the ambition of becoming an advanced economy by 2047.

From record highs to a five-month slide: Where are Sensex, Nifty headed?From record highs to relentless losses, Dalal Street's dream run has turned into a nightmare in just a few months. Is there any relief in sight for investors or is there more pain ahead?

Zerodha's Nithin Kamath flags sharp drop in trading activity amid market crashThe stock market fell sharply on Friday, with the Sensex dropping 1,414 points and the Nifty slipping below 22,150. The heavy selling wiped out nearly Rs 9 lakh crore in market value.

Citigroup employee's typo nearly led to $81 trillion blunder. Details hereThe payment was initially overlooked by two employees before a third employee caught it. Citi later reported the incident as a 'near miss' to the Federal Reserve and the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency (OCC).

Don't miss these money deadlines in March 2025: Special FDs, ITR, and more In case you have missed reporting income or made an error in your ITR, you can still fix it. The final deadline for filing an  updated return (ITR-U) is March 31, 2025.

Sensex falls 1,400 points as trade war fears rattle D-Street, Rs 9 lakh crore goneStock market crash: During today's trading session, Dalal Street plunged as Sensex tumbled 1,414 points and Nifty sank below 22,150 amid global trade war fears and foreign sell-off, erasing nearly Rs 9 lakh crore in market value.
GDP grows at 6.2% in Q3 2024-25, up from 5.6% in Q2For the financial year 2023-24, India recorded a real GDP growth rate of 9.2%, marking the highest annual growth in the past 12 years.

Nifty posts longest monthly losing streak in 29 years, over Rs 90 lakh crore goneForeign outflows, weak earnings and global uncertainty have wiped out over Rs 90 lakh crore in investor wealth from  since September 2024, when Nifty hit an all-time high of 26,277.35.

Technicolor India shuts down, over 3,000 employees affected The company currently employs 3,200 people across India, with nearly 3,000 in Bengaluru alone. The sudden move has left several employees in shock.

RuPay Debit Select Card: Check new features effective from April 1, 2025RuPay Debit Select Cardholders can enjoy one complimentary domestic airport lounge visit each quarter and two international lounge visits a year at participating lounges (conditions apply).

India needs tariff cuts, reforms to boost investments: World Bank The World Bank report titled 'Economic Memorandum India' also highlights that for India to become a high-income country by 2047, its per capita income must grow nearly eight times current levels.

What's your best asset in 20s? Not stocks or trading, says Radhika GuptaRadhika Gupta cautioned that young professionals might be focusing on passive income too early. She believes that the best investment in your 20s is not stocks or trading but your talent and time.

Smallcap, midcap indices set for worst month in 5 years. More pain ahead?In 2025 so far, mid-cap stocks have fallen 16%, while small-cap stocks have slumped 21%. In comparison, the benchmark Nifty 50 is down 6.7%.

NPCI introduces UPI Lite's 'Transfer Out' feature. All details hereAll issuer banks and UPI Apps must implement the required changes by March 31, 2025, as mentioned in NPCI's circular dated February 21, 2025

EPFO retains 8.25% interest rate on provident fund deposits for 2024-25In February 2024, the Employees' Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO) had increased the interest rate on EPF marginally to 8.25 per cent for 2023-24, from 8.15 per cent in 2022-23.

Explained: Why IT stocks like TCS, Infosys, Tech Mahindra are falling todayTech Mahindra was the biggest loser among IT stocks, down nearly 5.5% at the time publishing this report. Wipro was also down nearly 5%. Major IT firms such as TCS, Infosys and HCLTech were also down nearly 4% each.

Portfolio in red? Top mutual funds to consider amid stock market downturnInvestors are now looking for safer investment options as the markets have seen a huge correction. Mutual funds that balance risk and growth are a preferred choice among many.

Explained: Why Premier Energies shares tumbled up to 8% today The company's share price fell to a day's low of Rs 850 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). At around 12 pm, shares of Premier Energies were down 4.46% to Rs 881.80.

Ever heard of an alimony calculator? Here's how it worksAn alimony calculator is a tool that helps in determining the estimated financial support one spouse may need to pay the other after a divorce or separation.
India, EU aim to seal free trade pact by year-endThe EU is India's biggest trade partner in goods, with trade hitting $137.5 billion in 2023-24, nearly doubling in ten years.
Meta fires 20 employees for leaking internal information to mediaThe latest round of firings came following a recent series of reports based on Mark Zuckerberg's meetings with employees.

Stock market crash: 5 things investors should know as Sensex plunges 1,400 pointsStock market crash: Retail investors, already grappling with losses, are left wondering whether this correction will continue or if a recovery is on the horizon. Here are 5 things investors need to know
Sensex crashes 1,400 points: Why stock market is falling todayAt 12:53 PM, the S&P BSE Sensex was down 1,371.42 points at 73,241.01, while the NSE Nifty50 dropped 421.15 points to 22,123.90.

Bitcoin tumbles 5% to fall below $80,000 for first time since NovemberThe decline comes amid uncertainty over US President Donald Trump's trade policies, regulatory decisions on cryptocurrency, and concerns among investors after a major hack in rival digital currency ether.

Sensex plunges nearly 1,000 points, Nifty tumbles over 1%; IT, auto stocks bleedThe S&P BSE Sensex lost nearly 977.03 points to 73,635.40 at 10:06 am, while the NSE Nifty50 declined 303.60 points to 22,241.45 at 10:06 am.

Karnataka labour department finds no law violation in Infosys layoffs: ReportThe final report is expected to be submitted within a week, and a copy will also be sent to the Union labour department for further review.

Who is Tuhin Kanta Pandey? A look at his key roles in the governmentThe Appointments Committee of the Cabinet (ACC) has approved Tuhin Kanta Pandey's appointment for a term of three years. He is a 1987-batch Indian Administrative Service (IAS) officer from the Odisha cadre.

Tuhin Kanta Pandey appointed new Sebi Chairman, to succeed Madhabi Puri BuchTuhin Kanta Pandey, the current Finance Secretary, has been appointed as the new Chairman of market regulator Sebi. He will succeed Madhabi Puri Buch.

Amazon India hit with $39 million penalty for apparel trademark violationThe lawsuit was filed by Lifestyle Equities, the owner of the Beverly Hills Polo Club (BHPC) horse trademark. It claimed that Amazon India was selling apparel with a similar logo at lower prices.

Fixed vs floating interest rates: Which option to choose?Floating home loan interest rates are usually lower than fixed rates. Hence, they are more appealing when rates are likely to dip or stay stable.
Sensex, Nifty end flat despite banking and financial sector boostThe S&P BSE Sensex added 10.31 points to close at 74,612.43, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 2.50 points to end at 22,545.05.
Sensex, Nifty end flat despite banking and financial sector boostThe S&P BSE Sensex added 10.31 points to close at 74,612.43, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 2.50 points to end at 22,545.05.
Why NPS should be a part of your retirement plan? 5 things to knowWhen compared to fixed deposits (FDs) and Public Provident Funds (PPF), NPS offers superior returns over the long run.

Explained: Why NBFC stocks may offer stability in choppy marketsThe RBI's decision to ease certain loan rules and delay stricter regulations on capital requirements has improved sentiment in the financial sector. This has made NBFC stocks attractive options for investors.

Bitcoin sees 10% drop this week: 5 reasons behind the fallThe largest crypto has witnessed a decline of more than 10% over the last seven days. This downward trend comes amid US President Donald Trump's aggressive trade policies and EU tariff threats.

entertainment.headline: Anupamaa actor Sudhanshu Pandey breaks silence on rumoured feud with Rupali GangulyActor Sudhanshu Pandey has addressed the ongoing rumours about a feud with his Anupamaa co-star Rupali Ganguly. In an interview, he clarified the situation and dismissed the speculations.

BRIT Awards 2025: Charli XCX wins album of the year, full winners list hereCharli XCX emerged as a major winner at the Brit Awards 2025, securing multiple accolades. Artists including Sabrina Carpenter and Billie Eilish also took home some of the biggest awards of the night.

Honey Singh's Millionaire Delhi concert: A night of nostalgia, iconic hitsHoney Singh's Delhi concert was packed with nostalgic hits, emotional tributes, surprise guests, and exclusive remixes. The rapper promised bigger things ahead as his Millionaire Tour continues.

Justin Bieber celebrates 31st birthday with family, shares rare pics of son JackPop sensation Justin Bieber marked his 31st birthday with a heartwarming family gathering. He shared rare photos with wife Hailey and their son Jack, capturing the joyous occasion.

Singer Billy Joel stumbles and falls mid-performance, fans say 'that's painful'During a recent performance, legendary musician Billy Joel stumbled and fell onstage, causing fans to worry about his health. The incident has sparked widespread concern and discussions about the artist's well-being.

At sold-out Delhi concert, Honey Singh vows to bring Grammys to India. WatchAt his Delhi concert, Honey Singh wowed fans with his hits and vowed to bring a Grammy to India, inspired by AR Rahman's Oscars win. He also expressed his deep love for Delhi and its people.

Honey Singh set to perform in Delhi, excited fans rush to the venueSinger and rapper Honey Singh is set to perform in Delhi today as part of his ongoing Millionaire India tour. Ahead of the concert, excited fans were seen rushing to the venue as soon as the gates opened.

Honey Singh on online negativity against him: I've been here before YouTube existedSinger and rapper Honey Singh took a dig at those spreading negativity about him through YouTube podcasts. During his Lucknow concert last night, he also spoke about his lifestyle changes.

Shreya Ghoshal's X account hacked: Tried every thing in my capacityRenowned singer Shreya Ghoshal has disclosed that her X account has been compromised since February 13. Despite efforts, she remains unable to access or delete the account.
Splitsvilla 15's Rushali Yadav-Harsh Arora engaged: Just perfectly usSplitsvilla 15 contestants Rushali Yadav and Harsh Arora are now engaged. The couple fell in love on the show.

Nadaaniyan trailer: Ibrahim, Khushi's romance comes with a priceIbrahim Ali Khan is all set to making his acting debut in Nadaaniyan, a love story with a secret deal. Also starring Khushi Kapoor, the film explores romance, ambition, and chaos. It will start streaming on Netflix from March 7.

Honey Singh returns to Delhi for sold-out Millionaire concert: What to expectYo Yo Honey Singh's Millionaire India Tour hits Delhi with a sold-out show, 20,000 fans, top celebs, and a surprise setlist. His parents will attend the concert, making this emotional homecoming extra special.

general news.headline: India spin to win, Varun Chakravarthy architect of New Zealand downfall in DubaiIndia vs New Zealand, Champions Trophy 2025: Varun Chakravarthy picked up a five-wicket haul to help India beat New Zealand by 44 runs. India are set to face Australia in the first semifinal in Dubai on Tuesday, March 04.

Thanda thanda cool cool: Eknath Shinde denies rift, Devendra Fadnavis smilesEknath Shinde refuted rift rumours in Maharashtra's ruling Mahayuti, insisting his ties with Devendra Fadnavis and Ajit Pawar were "thanda thanda and cool cool". His "don't take me lightly" remark, however, hinted at underlying power tensions.

Karnataka Congress shake-up? 2 senior leaders back DK Shivakumar as Chief MinisterSenior Congress leader Veerappa Moily backed CM DK Shivakumar for the Karnataka Chief Minister, while MLA Basavaraju Shivaganga claimed the state Congress President would take charge of the top post by end of year.

Kinnar Akhada: How transgenders claimed a pivotal place in Hindu monastic orderFrom being empowered by Lord Rama to bestow blessings on all ceremonious occasions to being criminalised under British colonial laws to claiming an akhara in Kumbh Mela, kinnars have carved a distinct religious identity within Hinduism. This is very different from the Hijra traditions. This is all about kinnars, how they are different from hijras, and how they created a place for themselves in the Hindu monastic system.

Champions Trophy semi-final line-up confirmed: India to face Australia in DubaiThe semi-final line-ups in the Champions Trophy has been confirmed after India beat New Zealand in the final match of Group A. Sexual harassment case against self-styled Christian prophet Bajinder SinghThe woman alleged that while she was working with Bajinder Singh, he touched her inappropriately and made unwanted advances towards her since she was 17.

Union Minister says daughter harassed in Maharashtra, Devendra Fadnavis reactsUnion Minister Raksha Khadse on Sunday filed a complaint against few boys who allegedly harassed her minor daughter and other girls during the Sant Muktai Yatra in Maharashtra's Jalgaon.

Haryana Congress worker found dead, mother alleges killer may be from partyThe body of 22-year-old Congress worker Himani Narwal was found in a suitcase near a bus stand in Haryana's Rohtak district on Saturday. She had participated in Rahul Gandhi's Bharat Jodo Yatra, and her death has sparked demands for a high-level probe.

'Devendra Fadnavis and I switched roles, Ajit dada's is fixed', Eknath Shinde jokesMaharashtra Deputy Chief Minister clarified that all was well within the Mahayuti coalition government and there was no cold war.

We are on the Moon! Blue Ghost mission nails daring lunar landingThe Blue Ghost spacecraft spent about a month orbiting Earth before heading towards the Moon, where it refined its trajectory over 16 days in lunar orbit.

Supported by God's people: Pope Francis in stable condition, thanks well-wishersPope Francis remains in the hospital with stable blood circulation and no rise in white blood cells, suggesting his infection may be easing.

Fraud of EPIC proportions: Trinamool after poll body clarification on voter IDsThe Trinamool accused the Election Commission of aiding the BJP's alleged poll-rigging, citing duplicate voter ID numbers across states. The poll panel denied wrongdoing, dismissing claims of electoral roll manipulation as 'manual errors'.

Despite his T20I success, the pacer was overlooked again, leading to widespread criticism of Rohit Sharma and Gautam Gambhir.

IND vs NZ: Varun Chakravarthy gets a game, India play only 1 specialist pacerIndia vs New Zealand, CT 2025: India surprised quite a few with their team selection for their final Group A game against New Zealand. India played Mohammed Shami as their lone specialist pacer and added Varun Chakravarthy to an already spin-heavy line-up.

Virat Kohli joins legendary club with 300 ODIs for India Champions Trophy 2025: Virat Kohli became the seventh Indian cricketer to play 300 or more ODIs and he reached the landmark in the Group A match against New Zealand at the Dubai International Cricket Stadium.

A century from Virat Kohli in his 300th ODI would be magical to see: Dale SteynLegendary South Africa fast bowler Dale Steyn expressed his desire to get to see a century from Virat Kohli's bat in his 300th ODI. Kohli will play his 300th ODI vs New Zealand in ICC Champions Trophy 2025.

Virat Kohli is legendary because of his fighting spirit: Viv RichardsWest Indies legend Vivian Richards hailed Virat Kohli's resilience, calling his ability to thrive under pressure "legendary." NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".
